privacy.title: Privacy-first by design
privacy.description: <0>Your financial data is your business.</0> incomeTaxNL is a privacy-focused free and open source tool to estimate Dutch Box 1 and Box 3 taxes. Any data you enter is only stored locally in your browser. All calculations run 100% locally in your browser — your personal financial data is never sent, stored, or collected by this app for any reason.

list.item1: No risk of leaks, hacks, or misuse: your sensitive information never leaves your device.
list.item2: No tracking, no uploads, no analytics: you stay in control of your data.
list.item3: Use incomeTaxNL with confidence for salary and capital gains calculations, knowing your privacy is protected.

info.title: About incomeTaxNL
info.description: incomeTaxNL helps you estimate Dutch Box 1 salary tax and Box 3 wealth tax with a privacy-first approach. All calculations run locally, so your data never leaves your browser.

howToUse.title: How to use
howToUse.step1: Select Box 1 or Box 3 using the toggle at the top of the calculator.
howToUse.step2: Enter your income, savings, investments, and debts in the left-side forms.
howToUse.step3: Open the settings gear to tweak thresholds, return assumptions, or tax year.
howToUse.step4: Review the results panel for a breakdown of taxable bases and estimated taxes.

origin.title: Origin story
origin.description: Navigating Dutch taxes used to be confusing for me. I built an elaborate spreadsheet to make sense of the rules, but it was too complex for friends and colleagues. This app is the friendlier version—same clarity, with explanations that anyone can follow.

1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
1.content: By using incomeTaxNL, you agree to these Terms of Use. If you do not agree, please discontinue use of this tool immediately.

2.title: 2. Educational Purpose Only
2.content: incomeTaxNL is provided solely for educational and informational purposes. It is designed to help users understand and estimate Dutch income tax calculations. This tool does NOT constitute professional tax advice, legal advice, or financial planning services.

3.title: 3. No Warranty or Guarantee
3.content: All calculations and information are provided 'as is' without any warranty of accuracy, completeness, or fitness for a particular purpose. Tax laws, rates, and regulations may change, and this tool may not reflect the most current information. Users are responsible for verifying all results with official sources.

4.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
4.content: The creator and contributors of incomeTaxNL shall not be liable for any damages, losses, or tax liabilities arising from the use or misuse of this tool. Users assume all risks associated with using the estimates provided.

5.title: 5. Professional Consultation Required
5.content: For official tax calculations, filing, or advice, users must consult the Belastingdienst (Dutch Tax and Customs Administration) or a qualified tax professional.

6.title: 6. Privacy and Data
6.content: All data entered into incomeTaxNL is stored locally in your browser and never transmitted to any server. We do not collect, store, or share your personal or financial information. See our Privacy Policy for more details.

7.title: 7. Open Source License
7.content: incomeTaxNL is open source software available on GitHub. You may use, modify, and distribute it according to the terms of its license.

8.title: 8. Changes to Terms
8.content: These terms may be updated from time to time. Continued use of incomeTaxNL after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised terms.

9.title: 9. Contact
9.content: For questions or concerns, please contact us via GitHub Issues or direct message on X.

breakdown.title: Calculation breakdown
breakdown.intro: Here is the math spelled out step by step, with simple explanations:

1.explain: This is all the money you have in the bank and in investments, added together.

2.math: Capital yield tax base = total assets − deductible debts = {{assets}} − {{debts}} = {{base}}
2.explain: We subtract the debts you can deduct from your total money. This gives the amount the tax office looks at.

3.math: Basis for savings & investments = capital yield tax base − allowance = {{base}} − {{allowance}} = {{taxable}}
3.explain: You get a tax-free allowance. We take this away from the amount above. Only the rest is taxed.

4.math: Share in capital yield tax base = basis / capital yield tax base = {{basis}} / {{base}} = {{share}}%
4.explain: This shows what part of your money is taxed after the allowance. If you have little money, this part is small.

5.math: Income from savings & investments = taxable returns × share = {{returns}} × {{share}}% = {{income}}
5.explain: This is the amount the tax office thinks you earn from your savings and investments, based on rules.

6.explain: This is the final tax you pay. It is a percentage of the amount above.

guide.trigger: Where can I find this information?
guide.title: Reading Your Jaaropgave (Annual Statement)
guide.intro: A jaaropgave is the annual statement from your bank or broker showing your balances for tax purposes. Here's how to find the values you need for Box 3.

bank.title: Bank Accounts (Jaaropgave)
bank.description: Your bank sends a jaaropgave (annual statement) in January or February showing your balance on 1 January.

items.look1: "Saldo per 1 januari" or "Stand per 1 januari" — this is the balance you need
items.look2: "Vermogen op peildatum" — means wealth on reference date
items.look3: The document usually covers all accounts at that bank
items.bank5: Bunq — Check the app or web for "Year overview"
items.tip1: Add each account separately for clarity, or combine if simpler
items.tip2: Include all savings accounts, not just checking
items.tip3: Foreign bank accounts held in the Netherlands count too

investments.title: Investment Accounts (Beleggingen)
investments.description: Brokers and investment platforms provide an annual overview showing the market value of your portfolio on 1 January.

items.look1: "Waarde per 1 januari" or "Portefeuillewaarde" — total portfolio value
items.look3: Look for the value on 1 January, not 31 December
items.plat2: Meesman — Annual statement via email or portal
items.plat3: ABN AMRO Zelf Beleggen — Part of "Jaaroverzicht"
items.plat5: Brand New Day — "Jaaropgave" in your dashboard
items.tip1: Use the total market value, not purchase price
items.tip2: Include stocks, ETFs, bonds, and funds
items.tip3: Pension accounts (pensioen) are usually exempt — check with your provider
items.tip4: Crypto holdings are taxed in Box 3 — use value on 1 January

general.title: General Information
general.description: Important dates and concepts for Box 3 tax.

items.date1: Box 3 tax is based on your wealth on 1 January of the tax year
items.date2: For 2025 taxes, use balances from 1 January 2025
items.debt1: Mortgage on second home or investment property
items.debt4: Note: Primary home mortgage is NOT deductible in Box 3
